column4: hey, does anyone know if the rc.local file runs before or after the init.d scripts?
umm has to be run afterwards since it is a init.d script as well but it's teh last one to be run

thanks for that info, but why is it that the command i put into /etc/rc.local to change the default cpu scaling governor not work? it's always on ondemand .. and i have to re-execute it after boot `sudo /etc/rc.local`
think that can be changed using /etc/sysctl.conf nto sure though sicne I don't use linux that much anymore
